snippet: The government wants the pageant moved from Jakarta to Bali, where radical Islamist groups have less of a presence, but organizers are resisting.
abstract: Finals of the annual Miss World pageant are in jeopardy following a decision by the Indonesian government to relocate the competition from Jakarta to Bali because of opposition from radical Islamic groups; organizers say that it might not be possible to move the globally televised event on short notice.
lead_paragraph: The government wants the pageant moved from Jakarta to Bali, where radical Islamist groups have less of a presence, but organizers are resisting.

headline.main: Miss World Finals in Doubt After Indonesian Protests
headline.print_headline:
Indonesia: Miss World Pageant in Peril
After Opposition From Islamic Groups
